project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, when a service desk customer is not log in to confluence, they are requested to the first login when they search any KB in JIRA service desk. Instead of letting the JIRA service desk customer to log in confluence in JIRA service desk, it will open a new tab and redirect the user to the confluence. This caused the confluence URL to be exposed to the user.

After the JIRA service desk customer login to confluence, if the user opens a confluence page that contains a hyperlink to another confluence page and clicks the link, it will also open a new tab and redirect the user to confluence instead of loading the confluence page in JIRA service desk.

h3. How to reproduce
Please review the following video on how JIRA service desk behave when loading a Confluence page
 [^Recording #38.mp4] 

h3. Suggestion
# Allow the JIRA service desk customer to be auto login to confluence when login to JIRA service desk
# JIRA service desk will load the new confluence page in JIRA itself when a customer clicks a hyperlink to another confluence page and not opening a new tab and redirect the user to the confluence.
fields.summary: service desk should load the confleunce page in service desk when customer clicks a hyperlink to another confluence page instead of opening a new tab to confluence

fields.summary: Provide a mechanism to automate the creation of KB articles, based in rules configured by the administrator

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4.Description -
When adding over 2000 customers (as a group) for Service Desk Customers into the User and roles permission, will run into collation issue if MsSQL server collation is different to database collation.

h4. Scenario for the bug to occur -
* Customer permissions need to be set with *Customers who are added to the project*
 !customerpermission.jpg|thumbnail! 
* MsSQL server collation is not supported by Jira, i.e different from the database collation of {{SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI}}

h4. Expected Results -
Customer organization screen is populated with all users from the group

h4. Actual Results -

This happens when you click on the customer pane on the left hand side for Service Desk, you will see the error -
 !error.jpeg|thumbnail! 

You will also notice in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} the following stack trace -
{code}
2018-01-18 17:04:30,124 http-nio-8752-exec-2 ERROR admin 1024x2848x1 vlov11 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/pages/people/customers/pagination/DBCON/search [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT user_name FROM jiraschema.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ( select item from #temp4 ) ) AND (directory_id =  ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name (Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI" in the equal to operation.)
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT user_name FROM jiraschema.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ( select item from #temp4 ) ) AND (directory_id =  ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name (Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI" in the equal to operation.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:401)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:278)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUserDao.lambda$search$1(OfBizUserDao.java:854)
..
..
..
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT user_name FROM jiraschema.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name IN ( select item from #temp4 ) ) AND (directory_id =  ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name (Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI" in the equal to operation.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:533)
{code}

This is caused by Temp tables being created in Server collation instead of following the Jira database collation, and the limit of 2000 records requiring a temp table to be created instead of loading into memory.

h4. Workaround - 
*Options*
# Separate groups into smaller chunks of 1999 users then add them in as *Service Desk Customers*
# Do *not* select *Customers who are added to the project* for customer permissions
# Change MsSQL server collation to be the same as database collation i.e - {{SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI}}
fields.summary: Adding more than 2000 users into customer role hits collation error when going to customer organization pane for MsSQL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Core mail handler is designed to refer to ticket ID in the email subject or {{In-Reply-To}} value in the email header to update an existing issue in JIRA,. More explanation of this behaviour - [How JIRA Updates Issues from Email - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-jira-updates-issues-from-email-611812070.html].

h3. Suggested Solution
Design the mail handler to check for the email subject and there is an issue with the same Summary, update the issue instead of creating a new issue.
fields.summary: Enhance Incoming Mail

fields.description:
Currently there is an option to turn off Agents from organization management through - *Jira Administration* >> *Applications* >> *Jira SOFTWARE -> Configuration*
 !organization management.jpg|thumbnail!

The option -
 * No, only JIRA administrators can manage organizations
 Does turn off *Add Organizations* for Project admins but does {color:#ff0000}*not*{color} turn off *Add Customer*

h3. Suggestion -
 # Turn off *Add Customer* for Project administrators as well (lump them in with agents).
 # Or add another option to control Project administrators the same as for Agents on managing/adding customers

h3. Affects Share in customer portal also -
This also affects the *share* in customer portal, where it will restrict Agent from Sharing with an email that is not in Jira, which stops them from creating a new customer, but the Project administrator is not exempt and can still *Share* with an email not in Jira.
fields.summary: Prevent Project administrators from adding customers

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

The "Send email" automation rule does not take into account the option "Run as project default".


h3. +Steps to reproduce+

# Log into JIRA as a Service Desk project admin
# Go to the Service Desk Project Settings > Automation page
# Create an automation rule that sends an email to the reporter (customer) whenever the status of the issue changes. Select the option "Run as project default", as shown in the screenshot below:
 !LatestAutomationRule.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new Service Desk issue (make sure to set the Request Type, and to set the Reporter to a customer of the Service Desk project)
# Log into JIRA as an agent of the Service Desk project and change the status of this ticket, as shown in the screenshot below. Make sure that this agent is NOT the Project Default User.
 !IssueView_Transitions.png|thumbnail! 
# Check the notification received by the customer

h3. +Expected Result+

The notification email received by the customer should show that the sender is the Project Default (Julien Rey).

h3. +Actual Result+

The notification email received by the customer shows that the sender is the agent who changed the status of the issue (Julien3 Rey):
 !NotificationEmailFromAutomationRule.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Workaround+

No workaround.
fields.summary: The "Send email" automation rule does not take into account the option "Run as project default".

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

When the Satisfaction field is added to the Issue Edit Screen, the Satisfaction panel disappears whenever an issue is deleted

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

# Open a Service Desk issue that already has a Customer Satisfaction rating
# Click on "Edit", don't change anything in the Edit form, then click on "Update".
# Verify that the Customer Satisfaction panel is still here:
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click again on "Edit", and this time, then click on "Configure Fields" > "Where is my field?" and look for "Satisfaction"
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on the link to the screen used by the Issue Edit Form and add the field "Satisfaction" to the screen:
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 
# Go back to the issue and click on "Update" (without updating any field in the ticket)

h3. +Actual Result+

The "Customer Satisfaction" panel disappears:
!Step5.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Expected Result+

The "Customer Satisfaction" panel should not disappear.

h3. +Suggestions for the resolution of this bug+

2 options:
# Either prevent the admin user from adding the "Satisfaction screen", since this field is not editable anyway.
# Or prevent the "Update" button from clearing the "Customer Satisfaction" panel


h3. +Workaround+

Don't include the "Satisfaction" field from the Edit screen.
fields.summary: When the Satisfaction field is added to the Issue Edit Screen, the Satisfaction panel disappears whenever an issue is deleted

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Satisfaction Survey is only partially translated in case you leave the default question to be asked instead of customising it. It seems that all the other phrases in the survey, for example each of the five stars subtitle (i.e.:"Good", "Very Good"), are correctly translated based on the customer's profile configured language, however, the default question itself "How was our service for this request" is translated, or not, based on the application's default language, making the survey language inconsistent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Jira application default language is English
2) SD Project's default language is English, but Portuguese is an added preferred language as well.
3) Customer's profile configured language is set to Portuguese (pt-BR).
4) The Satisfaction Survey question is not customised (default question is always "How was our service for this request?").

Customer has mainly English customers, but also have customers that speak Portuguese.

h3. Expected results

User will receive the survey on his e-mail all translated correctly to Portuguese, including the survey's question, based on his profile's configured default language as per [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/translating-your-customer-portal-and-supporting-multiple-languages-886180551.html].
{quote}Customers can set their preferred language in their profile. If they don't, your portal detects the language set in your customer's browser. It will try to display this language first.

If you don't support their preferred language, the portal displays the project's default language. We recommend setting the default language to match the native language of the majority of your customers.{quote}

h3. Actual Results

Customer receives a survey with most of the field translated to Portuguese correctly, however, the survey's question itself is in English.

h3. Troubleshooting

We found that the survey's question always responds to the application default language, ignoring the customer's profile default language and the project's default language as well. It seems that this field behaves differently from the other fields in the survey, as you can see in the image attached.

h3. Workaround

If you customise the survey's question, it will show exactly what you have wrote in the field for everybody, so none of these rules applies. This doesn't work for projects that works with customers that speaks different languages, as it won't be translated in any way. The behaviour we're reporting this bug is for the default survey question that is already set on the application.

On both cases, this doesn't work for the customer as she has customers from different countries and neither setting a customised fixed questions that won't be translated or setting the application default language to the alternate language is applicable.
fields.summary: Satisfaction Survey question doesn't get translated according to user's profile or browser default language

fields.description:
When customers use the Customer Portal in JIRA Service Desk, they can attach files by pasting the content of the clipboard (CTRL+V in most cases). When a file is pasted this way, it is attached with the name 'image'png'. The issue with this is when more than one image is pasted as each file is named the same, and as we know, JIRA's expected behavior with thumbnails when having several files with the same name will cause all thumbnails to show only one of the images (the most recently attached, see bug ticket [JRASERVER-2169|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-2169]). The Customer Portal should be prepared for this.

The suggestion is for the Customer Portal to generate random (or different) names for each image pasted like it already does when attaching an issue from inside JIRA.
fields.summary: Improve behavior when pasting images on Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Service Desk agents are not sent regular notifications if they are also added to a ticket as part of an organization.

h3. Suggested Solution
Always send Agents Jira notifications, regardless of whether they are part of an organization added to the ticket.

h3. Workaround 
Change the notification for *Should customers receive Jira notifications?* to _Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira notifications_
You’ll find this setting under Administration > Applications > Jira Service Desk > Configuration
This will only affect Jira licensed users and Service Desk customers will continue to only receive customer notifications, so if customers are also Jira users, they will receive two notifications.
fields.summary: Send Agents notifications regardless of whether they are part of an organization

fields.description:
This is affecting the SAC migration to Automation for JIRA (talk to Shane Frensley for more details).

The problem is that comments added to servicedesk issues never get marked with INTERNAL, even if the comment property 'sd.public.comment' is correctly supplied with {noformat}{"key":"sd.public.comment","value":{"internal":true}}{noformat}.

The problem is that when you call JIRA's {noformat}commentService.create(loggedInUser, commentResult, false);{noformat}
then the comment will not be marked as 'INTERNAL' even if the comment property was set correctly.  

The specific problem here is the third param false (which stops this from dispatching an event/notification).  If it's set to true then the comment *is* marked as INTERNAL.

For full details I can give you access to https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/CBS-1288 or speak to Shane.
fields.summary: Comments not marked as internal when dispatchEvent boolean param is set to false

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

When a linked issue is clicked from an issue viewed from a Service Desk queue, the URL of this issue contains both the issue key and the queue ID. If we refresh the page, we are redirected to a random issue.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

# Create 1 Service Desk project and 1 Software project (called SD AND SW)
# Create an issue in the Service Desk project (called SD-1)
# Create a few issues in the Software Desk project (called SW-1, SW-2, SW-3...)
# Link both issues together
# Go to the queue page of the Service Desk project
# Click on the issue SD-1 from the queue
# From the issue SD-1, click on the linked issue (under "Issue Links") SW-1
# Check the URL from the URL box of the browser, and note that this URL is not the "browse" URL of the issue, but a URL containing one of the SD queue:
<BASE_URL>/projects/SD/queues/custom/16/SW-1
# Refresh the page

h3. +Expected Result+

After the refresh, we should stay on the same issue (SW-1).

h3. +Actual Result+

We are redirected to the last page that was visited from the Software project. For example, if the last page visited in the Software project was the Issues page, we are directed to the following page:
<BASE_URL>/projects/SW/issues/SW-3?filter=allopenissues

Depending on how the issues are prioritized in the software project, the user might see a different issue (SW-3) than the one that they were originally viewing (SW-1).

h3. +Suggestions for this issue+

It seems that if the URL contains a mix of a Service Desk queue and the key of an issue that does not belong to the Service Desk project, when we refresh the page, there is an incorrect redirection to a random issue.

When a user clicks on a linked issue from an issue viewed from a queue, the URL from the browser URL box should be the actual URL of the issue (<BASE_URL>/browse/SW-1), instead of a URL combining the queue and the issue key. This way, when the page is refreshed, the user won't be redirected to a random issue.
fields.summary: Incorrect redirection when refreshing the URL of a linked Software issue viewed from a Service Desk queue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

Whenever a Service Desk project is linked to a Space in Confluence with the "All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license." option selected, the Space permission is automatically configured in Confluence with the "Any active user can view this space" option, as shown in the screenshot below:

!SpacePermission_InConfluence.png|thumbnail!

Because of this space permission, any Confluence unlicense user who has the link of any KB in Confluence is able to access these KBs, regardless of which Service Desk Project they belong to.

While this behavior is clearly described in the Confluence Documentation [Give Access to Unlicensed Users from Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/give-access-to-unlicensed-users-from-jira-service-desk-829076204.html], it is not explained in the Service Desk Documentation [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver036/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-921471856.html], and can lead to some confusion, and can be seen as a security breach.
h3. +Suggested solutions+

Please improve the Service Desk documentation [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver036/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-921471856.html] to make it clear that whenever a Service Desk project is linked to a KB in Confluence, such KB will be accessible by any non-licensed users in Confluence.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation about connecting a Service Desk project to a KB by explaining the permission consequences on the Confluence side

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is only possible to set one goal value per SLAs in a Service Desk project, regardless of the time of the year.

Some companies have different SLA goals depending on the week of the year, so it would be helpful if the SLA goal could be automatically changed every week based on a calendar containing these goals.

h3. Suggested Solution

The suggestion for this feature request is to:
- add a functionality that can look up into an external calendar to fetch a number of days for each week of the year
- add a functionality that weekly updates the goal of an SLA based on the number of days fetched from the calendar

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, when performing import from Mantis to JIRA using mantis importer that is available in JIRA, it is not possible to import certain system field such as:
* Assigned To
* Reporter
* Created/updated date

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Allow Mantis importer in JIRA to import more system field from mantis.

h3. *Why this is important*
It is causing lots of overhead work due to lack of this feature in Mantis import in JIRA. 
 
h3. *Workaround* 
Currently, the field that is not being imported via the mantis import can be imported using CSV import. More details on CSV import can be found at [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]
fields.summary: Allow More System Field Import Option when Importing From Mantis to JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Current it seems like currently null value can be added to issue column on customfield value table. This causes a problem in JIRA during migration such as project import which fails due to a null value in the table.

We have a kb to address this behavior at [Project import fails with No 'issue' field for CustomFieldValue xxx|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-fails-with-no-issue-field-for-customfieldvalue-xxxx-293831070.html/] which is to remove the null value everytime the problem happens.

However, we cannot think of any reason why JIRA's DB schema should allow a NULL value for the issue column of customfieldvalue in the first place as there is no scenario require for such use case.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Add a 'not null' constraint to the ISSUE column on the customfieldvalue table so that null value won't be added to this particular table.
 
h3. *Workaround* 
(i) This requires database modification which is our of Atlassian support scope. Make sure to the backup database before performing this action.

It is possible to alter the table so that null value will not be added to the table by using below query{code}
ALTER TABLE customfieldvalue MODIFY (issue NOT NULL);
{code}

A restart is required for the changes to take place.
fields.summary: Add a 'not null' constraint to the ISSUE column on customfieldvalue table

*Problem definition:*

JIRA Service Desk does not allow to configure the same e-mail account for different projects for e-mail requests.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

Allow the users to configure the same e-mail address for different projects for JIRA Service Desk.

 

*Why is this important:*

When working on a lot of projects it makes hard to manage a lot of different e-mail accounts.

 

*Workaround:*

Each project is configured with its unique e-mail account.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

According to the name of the setting "Yes, send customers both JIRA Service Desk and JIRA notifications" from JIRA Admin > Applications > Service Desk > Configuration, by enabling this setting, customers should be able to:
- receive customer notifications (as configured in Project Settings > Customer notifications)
- receive JIRA notifications (as configured in the notification scheme in Project Settings > Notfications)

However, it does not look like this is the way this setting was designed, as I was not able to send both the JIRA and Customer notifications to any customer within my Service Desk project.

The only way I was able to send a customer both notifications was by adding the "Service Desk Team" role to this customer. This behavior seems to be contradictory with the name of the setting itself.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

*Test 1*
# Go to JIRA Admin > Applications > Service Desk > Configuration, and enable "Yes, send customers both JIRA Service Desk and JIRA notifications"
# In a Service Desk project, create a new customer from the "Customers" page
# Note that this user doesn't have any license (therefore no application access)
# Raise a request on behalf of this customer from the customer portal
# Resolve this issue by logging in as an Agent

*Test 2*
# Go to JIRA Admin > Applications > Service Desk > Configuration, and enable "Yes, send customers both JIRA Service Desk and JIRA notifications"
# In a Service Desk project, create a new customer from the "Customers" page
# Note that this user doesn't have any license (therefore no application access)
# *Add the Service Desk Team role to this customer in Project Settings > Users and roles*
# Raise a request on behalf of this customer from the customer portal
# Resolve this issue by logging in as an Agent
 

h3. +Expected Result+

*Test 1:*

The customer should receive both the Customer AND JIRA notification for the Issue Resolved event.

*Test 2:*

The customer should receive both the Customer AND JIRA notification for the Issue Resolved event.

h3. +Actual Result+

*Test 1:*

The customer only received the the Customer notification for the Issue Resolved event.

*Test 2:*

The customer received both the Customer AND JIRA notification for the Issue Resolved event.

h3. +Suggestions for this issue+

- If the behavior is incorrect, we should fix it to match the name of the setting
- If the behavior is as designed, then we should rename this setting and add some documentation about it so explain what the expected behavior, because the current definition is confusing and misleading
fields.summary: Rename the name "Yes, send customers both JIRA Service Desk and JIRA notifications" to match what it's doing (or change the behavior)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an administrator, I do want to restrict my agents from creating new customer accounts through the UI without revoking project admin permissions. 

Currently, any Service Desk agent (=User granted the *Service Desk Team* Permission) can create new customers either:
- by using the *Invite customer* button
- or in the Service Desk project sidebar
- or when creating a request in behalf of a customer that does not exist (in this case it will create a new internal user customer account for that email address)
- or when sharing an existing request with an email address does not exist (in this case it will create a new internal user customer account for that email address)

Additionally, any Jira global admin that's a Service Desk agent will be able to create customers even if they don't have project admin permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a new permission to manage customers.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to restrict agents/admins from creating new customers

fields.description:
Opened on behalf of customer.

h3. Summary
With the *Transition on Comment* Automation rule set to transition upon public customer comment, when a comment is posted by a customer user who is an Approver but is NOT the Reporter, NOT in Request Participants, and the request is NOT Shared with that customer's organization, then the Automation does not recognize the user as a customer.

h3. Environment
N/A

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the "Transition on Comment" rule as noted above
# Configure Approval for a status in your workflow
# Open a request and add an Approver that is not a Reporter/Participant
# Have this Approver make an external comment on the request

h3. Expected Results
# Request should automatically transition.  The Automation system should evaluate any customer user as a Customer no matter which user picker field it exists in.  

h3. Actual Results
Notice that the request does not transition, and that you see the same output as the attached screenshot which shows the rule processing the request as NOT from a Customer user.  

h3. Notes
In this instance, the Approver is a Customer management and not an Agent/Agent Manager

h3.Workaround
Add the Approver as a participant or share the issue with the Approver's organization.
fields.summary: Automation doesn't recognize a Customer user in the Approver field

* JIRA service desk version 3.5.2
* JIRA service desk version 3.9.0

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a customer with let say email address test@gmail.com
# Share a service desk request with this customer using *test@gmail.com*, it works fine.
# Remove the user as request participant and now try to share the same request to *Test@gmail.com*

(i) Note that in the last step the email is written in capital letter.

h3. *Expected Results*

When email address is entered as case sensitive below error is shown at customer portal:
 !Test from atlassian.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. *Workaround*
No workaround is available at the moment.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

When an internal comment is added to a Service Desk issue by a collaborator, if an agent tries to edit this comment to make it public by clicking on "Share with customer", the comment remains internal.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

- Install Service Desk 3.6.1
- Create 2 users in JIRA
-- Grant 1 user with a Service Desk license
-- Grant the other user with a different license (for example: Software)
- Create an issue in a Service Desk project
- Log in JIRA as the user who has a Software license (collaborator) and add a comment to the issue. The issue will be added as an internal comment since this user is a collaborator
- Log in JIRA as the user who has a Service Desk license (agent)
- Edit the comment, and click on "Share with customer"


h3. +Expected Result+

The comment should appear as public.

h3. +Actual Result+

The comment remains internal.

h3. +Suggested solutions to fix this behavior+

2 suggestions:
- We should either allow the comment to become public, in order to be consistent with what the "Share with customer" button was designed for
- Or, we should hide the "Share with customer" button to avoid any confusion from the agent, if the expected behavior is for any collaborator comment to remain internal
fields.summary: The "Share with customer" button should not be available when an internal comment was added internally by a collaborator

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The current [integration features|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html] available between Jira Service Desk and Confluence allows for customers to self-service problems by searching for articles from the customer portal or help center, or by viewing articles that agents share with them. 

It would be great to expand the self-help functionality available to customers by including the ability to *automatically* (without having to configure an automation rule for each KB article) trigger an email to the customer immediately after service request creation, which includes suggested KB articles based on keywords from their service request.
fields.summary: Email customers suggested KB articles based on keywords

fields.description:
Hi there,

We have disabled email requests on our Service Desk as we found customers would not raise tickets with all of the required information and this would lead to a bottleneck in the queue while we tried to get them to respond to us.

This doesn't mean that customers will never send a new issue to project email address but unfortunately there is no response supplied if you disable the email requests feature. Our customers may believe that they have raised a ticket with us when in fact their email has gone nowhere. We are using 'noresponse@domain'. Although the address is self explanatory, we all know you cannot assume anything with customers!

I contacted your Support who were very helpful but said I can only configure a bounceback if I turn on the requests but is not an option for us.

Can we have a new feature to use a bounceback mail if you disable the requests please? 

Example, 

Thank you for contacting <CompanyName>, if you need Technical Support please visit <PortalURL> as this account is not monitored.

 

Kind Regards,

Aoife Duggan
fields.summary: Email Requests: Configure a bounceback mail when disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

ServiceDeskOnCompletionExpectationManagerImpl Inconsistent Cache state prevents customer notifications from being sent
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk 3.9.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an Agent, Resolve an issue an existing issue via transition

h3. Expected Results

customer would get notification of case being resolved
h3. Actual Results

No notification is being sent to the customer, but the case is still getting resolved in Service Desk. In the logs we see the error
{code:java}
2017-11-30 08:35:22,983 http-nio-8080-exec-2 WARN kamil 515x1800x1 1gvj1mo 172.20.7.1,127.0.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.p.b.internal.events.ServiceDeskOnCompletionExpectationManagerImpl] Inconsistent Cache state, as object returned event 'com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEvent@dcaf0ad[issue=CS-2479,comment=com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64,worklog=<null>,changelog=[GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][id,40615][issue,22104][author,admin][created,2017-11-30 08:35:22.927],eventTypeId=13,sendMail=true,params={eventsource=workflow, baseurl=https://jira.pass},subtasksUpdated=false]' but expecting 'IssueChangedEventImpl{changeItems=[com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@52668145[fieldType=jira,field=resolution,from=<null>,fromString=<null>,to=1,toString=Fixed,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927], com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@1683f5bf[fieldType=jira,field=status,from=10301,fromString=Waiting for customer,to=5,toString=Resolved,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927]], author=Optional[kamil(admin)], comment=Optional[com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64], issue=CS-2479, eventTime=Thu Nov 30 08:35:22 UTC 2017, sendMail=true}'
2017-11-30 08:35:23,011 http-nio-8080-exec-2 WARN kamil 515x1800x1 1gvj1mo 172.20.7.1,127.0.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.p.b.internal.events.ServiceDeskOnCompletionExpectationManagerImpl] Inconsistent Cache state, as object returned event 'com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEvent@dcaf0ad[issue=CS-2479,comment=com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64,worklog=<null>,changelog=[GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][id,40615][issue,22104][author,admin][created,2017-11-30 08:35:22.927],eventTypeId=13,sendMail=true,params={eventsource=workflow, baseurl=https://jira.pass},subtasksUpdated=false]' but expecting 'IssueChangedEventImpl{changeItems=[com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@462a365a[fieldType=jira,field=resolution,from=<null>,fromString=<null>,to=1,toString=Fixed,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927], com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@6f352c2e[fieldType=jira,field=status,from=10301,fromString=Waiting for customer,to=5,toString=Resolved,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927]], author=Optional[kamil(admin)], comment=Optional[com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64], issue=CS-2479, eventTime=Thu Nov 30 08:35:22 UTC 2017, sendMail=true}'
2017-11-30 08:35:23,022 http-nio-8080-exec-2 WARN kamil 515x1800x1 1gvj1mo 172.20.7.1,127.0.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.p.b.internal.events.ServiceDeskOnCompletionExpectationManagerImpl] Inconsistent Cache state, as object returned event 'com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEvent@dcaf0ad[issue=CS-2479,comment=com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64,worklog=<null>,changelog=[GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][id,40615][issue,22104][author,admin][created,2017-11-30 08:35:22.927],eventTypeId=13,sendMail=true,params={eventsource=workflow, baseurl=https://jira.pass},subtasksUpdated=false]' but expecting 'IssueChangedEventImpl{changeItems=[com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@6c1ebaeb[fieldType=jira,field=resolution,from=<null>,fromString=<null>,to=1,toString=Fixed,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927], com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@e8b73f[fieldType=jira,field=status,from=10301,fromString=Waiting for customer,to=5,toString=Resolved,created=2017-11-30 08:35:22.927]], author=Optional[kamil(admin)], comment=Optional[com.atlassian.jira.issue.comments.CommentImpl@c9797e64], issue=CS-2479, eventTime=Thu Nov 30 08:35:22 UTC 2017, sendMail=true}' 
{code}
h3. Notes
 * The transition is firing an issueevent, but this event is also subsequently triggering other actions on the same thread. In turn when SD goes to check this issue in order to create the jsd notification, the status has already changed for that issue which in turn is generating this inconsistent cache state as an error that indicates jsd cannot send a message on this issue.
 * It is possible that other event based actions in Jira could also be affected by this bug. So far we just focused on notifications not working. But it follows that other event driven features such as automation, could be affected by these nested events not all getting fired as expected.

h3. Workaround
 # navigate to $JIRAURL /secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa you will need to be a Jira system administrator to reach this page
 # remove the feature flag "sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled"
 # While this work-around can help prevent the event based problems noted in this bug, once the upgrade for 3.9.2 has been released/applied, I would recommend turning back on "sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled" so that get the benefits of faster requests (SLA indexing / updating and others will happen asynchronously).
fields.summary: Customer notifications not being sent when issue is resolved due to inconsistent cache state

fields.description:
The "Share" button of the Customer portal requests should respect the current configuration of the Customer Portal. If the portal is not configured for New Customers, the "Share" function shouldn't allow the creation of new customers, as it currently does.
 * This is currently possible if Project admin, Jira administrator or Jira System Administrator share to new customer from portal.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Login to Customer portal as either Project admin, Jira administrator or Jira System Administrator.
 # Configure a Customer Portal with the permission that should not allow anyone to create the account
 # Create a Service Desk request
 # Share it with an e-mail that doesn't belong to any other account
 # You'll notice that the E-mail will be added as a customer on the portal

h3. Workaround

The following workaround may or may not be suitable for your team. It disables Jira service desk "Share" feature for any user input, even those inside your organisation. The share button will show, but the Share button will do nothing.

Please note that this workaround does not affect Jira's inbuilt Share feature, which is not affected by this unwanted behavior (   !Screen Shot 2019-12-23 at 3.32.47 pm.png|thumbnail!  )
 # Edit {{JIRA_INST/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/urlrewrite.xml}}
 # Insert the following block immediately before the final {{</urlrewrite>}} tag:
{code:java}
		<!--Workaround for JSDSERVER-5531 -->
		<rule>
		    <from>^/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/participants/.*/share$</from>
		    <condition type="method">PUT</condition>
        <set type="status">403</set>
        <to>null</to>
		</rule>
{code}

 # Restart the application for the changes to take effect
fields.summary: Customer portal "Share" unwanted customer creation when login using Admin user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1540].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Resolve/Close request transitions in a Service Desk instance do not trigger the appropriate notifications to Agents/JIRA Users according to the notification scheme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define users/groups under the Issue Resolved and/or Issue Closed notification settings of a Service Desk project's notification scheme.
# Create a Service Desk request in the Service Desk of step 1
# Resolve the request of step 2

h3. Expected Results
The users or members of the group as defined under step 1 should receive notifications of the request being resolved

h3. Actual Results
The members of the group or entities do not receive any notifications of the request resolution

h3. Root cause
In the Service Desk default generated workflow, the transition that resolves requests fires a Generic Event in the transition post-functions.
The notification scheme however acts on the Issue Resolved event. Since this is not defined in the post-functions, no notifications will be send.

h3. Workaround
There are 2 possible workarounds for this issue.
# Add the users/groups in the notification scheme to the "Generic Event" instead of the "Issue Resolved" notification. This will however trigger notifications on all Generic Events within that project to the defined user/groups
# In the relevant workflows, change the "Fire a Generic event" to "Fire a Issue Resolved event". Ensure you do this for all resolve issue transitions in all workflows, and do not forget to publish the workflows after the changes have been made in order for the changes to take effect
fields.summary: JSD default/generated workflow, "Resolve this issue" transition is firing Generic Event

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

If we configure a Service Desk automation rule that alerts a user when a comment is added to an issue, when the rule is triggered, it keeps alerting the user in the issue indefinitely.
This behavior is happening with Service Desk 3.9.0, but was not happening with previous versions.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

- In a Service Desk project, create an automation rule that alerts a user when a comment is added to an issue
 !Rule_Configuration.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an issue within the project
- Add a comment to the issue
- Refresh the issue

h3. +Expected Result+

- The alert is added indefinitely to the issue
 !Issue_Example.png|thumbnail! 
- The automation rule logs show that the rule is being triggered indefinitely:
 !JIRA_760.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Actual Result+

The automation rule should detect that there is a loop and should prevent any additional comment to be added to the issue, like it used to be the case in 3.8.x:
 !JIRA_740.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Workaround+

Go to the dark feature page: <JIRA-BASE-URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
Click on the "Disable" button next to the dark feature sd.internal.base.off.thread.on.completion.events.enabled
With this dark deature disabled, the loop detection should work again and only one alert will be added to the issue.
fields.summary: Infinite comments are added to an issue if an automation rule triggers an alert when a comment is added to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is only possible to configure a Calendar with fixed working hours for each day of the week.
 For example: 9am-5pm for every week day from Monday to Friday.

The problem is that for some companies, there might be specific days where the working hours are different than for the rest of the week.
 Here is an example of use case: a company has the working hours 9am-5pm on every day of the week, except for Monday Oct 1st where the working hours at 10am-4pm.
 This configuration is not possible, since in the calendar it is only possible to configure the working hours for all the Mondays of the years, and it is not possible to change the working hours just for a specific Monday.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if in the calendar we could configure different working hours for specific days of the year.

For example:
 - every Monday is configured with 9am-5pm
 - only one Monday (Oct 1st) is configured with 10am-4pm
fields.summary: Add the possibility to configure different working hours for a specific date

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

According to [JIRA Service Desk 3.6.x release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-6-x-release-notes-915154145.html], the SLA rendering has been improved to include days and weeks.

This improvement is not documented in the official [SLA documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/setting-up-slas-939926373.html].


h3. Why this is important

It is really important to explain how the new rendering works and how the number of days is calculated, because the way it is calculated now is complex and not straight forward, and doesn't always make sense to our customer.

Here is an example:
- Let's assume that there is a calendar with 5 days a week and 8 hours per day.
- Let's assume that there is an SLA configured with this calendar and a goal of 40h (1 week).
- There will be situations where the remaining time will be displayed in the issue view as 3d 14h.
- This rendering can be confusing for the user. Since 1 day = 8 hours, it would make "more sense" that the displayed time is 4d 6h instead of 3d 14h, without having any documentation explaining how the time is displayed.

h3. Suggestions:

# Provide a clear documentation explaining how the number of days is calculated in the SLA
# Provide the JIRA Admin with the option to modify the way the time is rendered (for example, provide the option to display 4d6h instead of 3d14h)
fields.summary: Add documentation about improved SLA rendering, and the option to change it

fields.description:
*Experienced Behavior*

When sharing a request in the portal an error is encountered. This error cannot be read because the page quickly refreshes causing the error to disappear. This did not happen in previous versions. 

*Expected Behavior*

Error remains visible to the user so they may review error and take necessary actions. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create sample project
# Edit an issue to make description empty
# Mark description field as required in the sample project's field configuration scheme
# Attempt to share the issue through the portal
# Error appears and quickly disappears
#* Error: "Failed to update request participants field, errors:"
#* Test in 3.5.2 to see error without refresh

*Testing Notes*
Only versions that were tested are mentioned below. This is not intended to include all versions

Testing shows error disappears in the following versions: 
* 3.8.3
* 3.7.1

fields.description:
We love the customer satisfaction module, but I'd like to have a little more control over it as a manager. 

Specifically, I'd like to allow admins to change/remove scores. Why? Because sometimes users get confused and select 1 thinking that's the best or have mouse/Outlook/browser issues that somehow result in a 1 star rating. When I call them to ask them why they rated a member on our team a 1, they say they were happy with the service and meant to give a 5. So I'd like to either just blow away that 1 or be able to edit based on what the user says. For disclosure, you could put any 'edited' scores permanently in a different color - say green stars vs yellow stars on the report page for customer satisfaction. That would keep abuse to a minimum because it would be clear that the score changed. We could use an internal comment to justify the change. Out of fairness to my team, my upper management isn't going to care that an end user made a mistake and gave an individual one star but absolutely will consider that 1 star part of their overall work performance which is a bummer. I want to be able to go to bat for them to manually override a legitimate error if it occurs. This feature, of course, could be disabled in the project settings for those who don't want to allow any modifications.

Thanks for considering!
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction: Allow Admins to Edit/Remove Scores

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Starting in JIRA 7.4.0/JSD 3.6.0, a new *Request Type Cache* was introduced, which helped improve the performance of various parts of JIRA Service Desk which were originally more database intensive. This cache is invalidated in certain circumstances; generally when changes are made to JIRA's Issue Types or Request Types, just for example.

One specific circumstance where the cache would be invalidated and rebuilt would be when a field is present on a Request Type, where that same field is not present on the Create Issue Screen associated with that Request Type's *Issue Type* and *Project*. This marks the field as an *Obsolete* field, which JIRA will be able to repair by removing the field off of the Request Type.

(x) This logic does not work properly if a dynamic field (such as JIRA Service Desk's *Organizations* field) is being treated as an *Obsolete* field. If *Organizations* is removed off of the *Create Issue Screen* associated with the Request Type, JIRA will invalidate the Request Type Cache and attempt to repair the Request Type by removing *Organizations*, which is not possible.

This will cause JIRA to always try to invalidate the cache upon loading the Customer Portal or accessing the Request Type in question, leading to excessive database calls as the cache is rebuilt over and over again. This can lead to performance issues (e.g. Slow Loading Customer Portals) in larger environments, or in environments where there are very many Request Types.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.4.0+/JSD 3.6.0+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a brand new JIRA 7.4.0/JSD 3.6.0 instance
 # Create at least *two* new JIRA Service Desk projects (i.e. JSD1, and JSD2, both Basic Service Desks)
 # From the Customer Portal, create a new Request for yourself in JSD1 (i.e. IT Help)
 # Remove *Organizations* from JSD1's screen associated with the Create Issue operation
 # Enable SQL Logging
 # Add DEBUG Logging for both of the following packages
 ** {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator}}
 ** {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.base.internal.cache.CacheFactoryManagerImpl}}

(!) Finally, access {{$JIRA_URL/servicedesk/customer/portals}}.
h3. Expected Results

No cache invalidation occurs.
h3. Actual Results

Cache invalidation is observed from either atlassian-jira.log or Tomcat's catalina.out/stdout logs:
{code:java}
2017-11-19 10:32:49,903 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Invalidating 1 Request Type cache references
2017-11-19 10:32:49,903 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Done invalidating Request Type cache references
2017-11-19 10:32:49,903 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Invalidating 14 Request Type caches
2017-11-19 10:32:49,903 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Done invalidating Request Type caches
2017-11-19 10:32:49,916 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Invalidating 1 Request Type cache references
2017-11-19 10:32:49,916 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Done invalidating Request Type cache references
2017-11-19 10:32:49,916 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Invalidating 14 Request Type caches
2017-11-19 10:32:49,916 http-nio-9013-exec-25 DEBUG kliou 632x767x1 g39lf3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.requesttype.RequestTypeInternalCacheInvalidator] Done invalidating Request Type caches{code}
Excessive SQL queries are observed in atlassian-jira-sql.log, when compared to when *Organizations* is not removed from the screen
h3. Workaround

Add the *Organizations* field back to all affected Request Type's Create Issue screens.
fields.summary: Request Type Cache Invalidation when Dynamic Fields are removed from Create Issue Screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver038/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-935909471.html], there's a setting for Viewing Access that says *All active users and customers* rather than *Only licensed users*. 

In Cloud, this automatically gives access to a Service Desk Customer when searching the Knowledge Base that is linked to a Service Desk Project. When they click on an article, it automatically loads the article. This is likely due to Cloud having SSO.

However, in Server, it doesn't necessarily have a method that passes on the login to Confluence to allow access. When clicking on the article, it passes them to the following login prompt:

 !Screen Shot 2017-11-16 at 5.24.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

When users see this, it causes confusion since the article doesn't mention this prompt at all, and many assume, as myself and many others did, that it requires a Confluence login here. However, this is not the case, and the user is able to login with the same Service Desk Customer account that they used to access the Customer Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the article above to include information about the login process, so customers do know if they aren't using SSO or something that passes the login information between instances that they will need to login again using the same Service Desk Customer details.

h3. Why this is important
I was able to find a few bugs in jira.atlassian.com that were closed simply due to this misunderstanding, and it's a question I get a lot in Community, so I feel that clarification is needed.
fields.summary: Clarify login process for Customer access to Knowledge Base

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently when an email request is failed to be processed by email channel the only way is to check the processing log or JIRA incoming log.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Implement a feature in JIRA service desk whereby every email request that is failed to proceed should trigger a failure notification to the project admin

h3. *Why this is important*
This will help the project admin to have a better overview of the email that was failed to proceed at their end. This will simply the admin task whereby they would not need to check logs or wait until a customer report to them when an email is not processed.
fields.summary: Sent notification to Project Admin When Mail Request Flagged as Failure

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, it's not possible to leave restricted comments for Approvers who do not have application access to Jira.

h3. Suggestion
Allow comment visibility configuration for Portal

h3. Why is it important
* Example use case
{quote}When we send an issue to an Approver, often we need to write a private
comment for her - for example, to give her additional information that
might help her to make a decision about approving or rejecting the request.
Sometimes this information may include technical details or sensitive data
that cannot be shared to other person. Thus, this kind of comment should
be visible to the Approver only, and not to the Request participants.
Moreover, usually the Approver does not have a JIRA account so we cannot
use the internal comments for that.{quote}
fields.summary: Restricted comments for Approvers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Setting the Resolution field without resolving the issue sends an Issue Resolved notification. We have a workflow status called Resolution Suggested and we set the Resolution field so the customer can confirm we have addressed their problem. They are understandably angry when they get an email saying the issue has been resolved if they don't believe it is. In fact, the issue is _not_ Resolved and the notification is incorrect.

This is a bug because this notice should only be sent when the Resolution field is set *and* the issue is Resolved:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver032/configuring-service-desk-notifications-828800691.html
{quote}
When a customer submits a request, they receive email notifications as the issue reporter when:
(...)
* the request is resolved with a set resolution field
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.2.8
* Service Desk 3.2.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen for use in a workflow transition.
# Add the Resolution field to the screen.
# As an agent, transition the issue and select a Resolution.

h3. Expected Results
* Service Desk should send an Issue Updated notification.

h3. Actual Results
* Service Desk sends an Issue Resolved notification.

h3. Notes

The "Suggest Resolution" transition does not fire the Issue Resolved event, does not set the Resolution Date, and the Resolution Suggested status is an "In Progress" type, not a "Done" type.
 !transition-resolution-suggested.png|thumbnail! 

We have multiple Resolve Issue transitions and these do meet the criteria stated in documentation.
!transition-accept-resolution.png|thumbnail! 
!transition-resolve-issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround is known.
fields.summary: Setting Resolution field without resolving the issue sends a false Issue Resolved notification

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
The new SLA rendering feature will accumulate partial day SLA run as hour and this can go up to more than 24hr, rather than showing 24hr as 1 day. This is creating confusion to Agents and customers.

For example, with a 24/7 calendar if a ticket is created has been breached for 1 day 26hrs, it is showing -1d 26hr instead of _2d 2h_. The current logic is being calculated as below.

{panel}
* Full day is considered as 0000 - 2400 in a 24/7 calendar.
* If the SLA breached full day from 0000 - 2400 this will be counted as full day and display as _-1d_.
* If the SLA breached partial day from 0100 - 2400 this will be counted as partial day and will be accumulated in hr and display as _-23 h_.
* So if we have SLA breached in 2 partial day for example from 0100 - 2400 on both days and one full day 0000 -2400, the SLA time will be displayed as _-1d 46h_.
{panel}


h2. Suggestion
Show the SLA as _-2d 22h_ instead of _-1d 46h_.

h2. Why is this important
With the current display this is creating confusion to Agent and Customer and manual calculation has to be done to find out how many days this has been breached. And also, the hour could go up to more than 24hr which at times this may accumulate to 100 or even 1000 of hours (-1d 500h)
fields.summary: Improve SLA time display to show 24h as 1 day

fields.description:
*Experienced Behavior:* 

JIRA Service Desk PSMQ enters a state where a single thread is repeatedly checking the same queue. This loops forever, consuming high CPU and may eventually cause OOME.
* This may occur for multiple queues. Each queue will have one lopping thread.

*Expected Behavior:*

JSD Automation / PSMQ does not encounter a situation where it repeatedly loops over a single queue 

*Steps to Reproduce:*

Encounter or create scenario where:
* "AO_319474_QUEUE" table shows non-zero value in "MESSAGE_COUNT"
* AND
* "AO_319474_MESSAGE" table shows zero messages associated with that queue 

To encounter scenario: 
* It is suspected that this may occur when a JIRA Data Center node is shut down while it is processing automation rules. This suspected cause has not been confirmed in the wild.

To create scenario: 
* Modify database so as to reproduce scenario. In new instance: 
** Create sample JSD project
** Bulk add comment to customer
*** This will create rows in "AO_319474_QUEUE"
** {{update "AO_319474_QUEUE" set "MESSAGE_COUNT"  = 1}}
*** This will make the rows "bad"
** Bulk add comment to customer
*** This will trigger automation which will check the queues and loop. 
** Observe: Thread dumps show 42 PsmqAsyncExecutors-job threads. 

Workaround:

The following query can be used to check for rows that may encounter this behavior: 

{code}
select Q."NAME", Q."MESSAGE_COUNT", count(M."ID") as real_message_count from "AO_319474_QUEUE" as Q left join "AO_319474_MESSAGE" as  M  on M."QUEUE_ID" = q."ID"  group by Q."NAME", Q."MESSAGE_COUNT" having count(M."ID") = 0 AND Q."MESSAGE_COUNT" != 0;
{code}

If thread dumps reveal looping threads, use the following to correct the offending rows. 

{code}
update "AO_319474_QUEUE" set "MESSAGE_COUNT" = 0 where "NAME" in (select Q."NAME" from "AO_319474_QUEUE" as Q left join "AO_319474_MESSAGE" as  M  on M."QUEUE_ID" = q."ID"  group by Q."NAME", Q."MESSAGE_COUNT" having count(M."ID") = 0 AND Q."MESSAGE_COUNT" != 0);
{code}

*Notes*
* Encountered by customer in JIRA 7.2.11 with JSD 3.2.11
* Reproduced using "create scenario" steps in JIRA 7.5.2 with JSD 3.8.3  and 7.6.0 with JSD 3.9.0
* Suspected to not impact 7.6 JIRA "because Automation behavior was fixed to use different claimants for each node."
* This can cause stability issues (OOM) when accompanied by JRASERVER-66158
fields.summary: PSMQ automation thread loops over queue due to message count discrepancy
